lightExplanation: Aglaonema Maria lives well in low light and loves a not too bright light. Care with the direct sunlight because the leaves will scorch.
waterExplanation: Water your Aglaonema Maria regularly, Keep the soil slightly moist during the summer and in the winter the topsoil should be dry out slightly between each watering.
humidityExplanation: This aglaonema can endure less humidity than some other plants, yet it will still appreciate your efforts to improve surrounding humidity levels, either via regular misting or using a pebble tray.
fertilizerExplanation: Fertilize it one or twice a year during the growing season.
tips: Mist the leaves to increase humidity.
Wipe the leaves with a damp cloth and gently dry to keep them clean and healthy.
Keep it far from cats, dogs and children because it causes mouth irritation.
